docblock.description: Fetches all rows from the database using sequential keys.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SELECT statement.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind into the SELECT statement.

docblock.description: Fetches all rows from the database using associative keys (defined by the first column).
docblock.long-description: N.b.: if multiple rows have the same first column value, the last row with that value will override earlier rows.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of component parts for a SELECT, or a literal query string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind into the SELECT statement.

docblock.description: Fetches the first column of all rows as a sequential array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of component parts for a SELECT, or a literal query string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind into the SELECT statement.

docblock.description: Fetches the very first value (i.e., first column of the first row).

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of component parts for a SELECT, or a literal query string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind into the SELECT statement.

docblock.description: Fetches an associative array of all rows as key-value pairs (first column is the key, second column is the value).

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of component parts for a SELECT, or a literal query string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind into the SELECT statement.

docblock.description: Fetches one row from the database.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of component parts for a SELECT, or a literal query string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind into the SELECT statement.

docblock.description: Safely quotes a value for an SQL statement.
docblock.long-description: If an array is passed as the value, the array values are quoted and then returned as a comma-separated string; this is useful for generating IN() lists.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to quote.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An SQL-safe quoted value (or a string of separated-and-quoted values).

docblock.description: Quotes a value and places into a piece of text at a placeholder; the placeholder is a question-mark.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text with placeholder(s).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data value(s) to quote.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An SQL-safe quoted value (or string of separated values) placed into the orignal text.

docblock.description: Quote multiple text-and-value pieces.
docblock.long-description:
The placeholder is a question-mark; all placeholders will be replaced with the quoted value. For example ...

{{code: php $sql = Solar::factory('Solar_Sql');

$list = array(
     "WHERE date > ?"   => '2005-01-01',
     "  AND date < ?"   => '2005-02-01',
     "  AND type IN(?)" => array('a', 'b', 'c'),
);
$safe = $sql->quoteMulti($list);

// $safe = "WHERE date > '2005-01-02'
//          AND date < 2005-02-01
//          AND type IN('a','b','c')"

}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: A series of key-value pairs where the key is the placeholder text and the value is the value to be quoted into it. If the key is an integer, it is assumed that the value is piece of literal text to be used and not quoted.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Return the list pieces separated with this string (for example ' AND '), default null.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An SQL-safe string composed of the list keys and quoted values.

docblock.description: Quotes a single identifier name (table, table alias, table column, index, sequence). Ignores empty values.
docblock.long-description:
If the name contains ' AS ', this method will separately quote the parts before and after the ' AS '.

If the name contains a space, this method will separately quote the parts before and after the space.

If the name contains a dot, this method will separately quote the parts before and after the dot.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The identifier name to quote. If an array, quotes each element in the array as an identifier name.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The quoted identifier name (or array of names).

docblock.description: Quotes all fully-qualified identifier names ("table.col") in a string, typically an SQL snippet for a SELECT clause.
docblock.long-description:
Does not quote identifier names that are string literals (i.e., inside single or double quotes).

Looks for a trailing ' AS alias' and quotes the alias as well.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string in which to quote fully-qualified identifier names to quote. If an array, quotes names in each element in the array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The string (or array) with names quoted in it.

docblock.description: Get the last auto-incremented insert ID from the database.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table name on which the auto-increment occurred.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the auto-increment column.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The last auto-increment ID value inserted to the database.

docblock.description: Inserts a row of data into a table.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table to insert data into.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array where the key is the column name and the value is the value to insert for that column.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of rows affected, typically 1.

docblock.description: Updates a table with specified data based on a WHERE clause.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table to udpate.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array where the key is the column name and the value is the value to use for that column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL WHERE clause to limit which rows are updated.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of rows affected.

docblock.description: Deletes rows from the table based on a WHERE clause.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table to delete from.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The SQL WHERE clause to limit which rows are deleted.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of rows affected.

docblock.description: Binds an array of scalars as values into a prepared PDOStatment.
docblock.long-description: Array element values that are themselves arrays will not be bound correctly, because PDO expects scalar values only.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The prepared PDOStatement.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The scalar values to bind into the PDOStatement.

docblock.description: Quotes an identifier name (table, index, etc); ignores empty values and values of '*'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The identifier name to quote.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The quoted identifier name.

docblock.description: Quotes all fully-qualified identifier names ("table.col") in a string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string in which to quote fully-qualified identifier names to quote. If an array, quotes names in each element in the array.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The string (or array) with names quoted in it.

docblock.description: Given a column specification, parse into datatype, size, and decimal scope.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column specification; for example, "VARCHAR(255)" or "NUMERIC(10,2)".

tag.name: return
tag.description: A sequential array of the column type, size, and scope.

docblock.description: Returns a list of database tables.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The list of tables in the database.
